programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy faces the vicious claws of a troubled cat that is terrorising a family about to bring home a newborn baby. He meets an inspirational feline named Skinny

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The Wardens rush to save a sick bald eagle. While checking deer camps near the Mexico border, a Warden finds himself in a high-stakes foot pursuit

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff tries to save a dog kicked in the head by a horse, and tackles a neighbourhood overrun with feral cats. A pet ferret displays worrying symptoms

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Jane hunt for black bears, but soon find themselves coming face to face with a grizzly. Meanwhile, Otto and Eivin introduce new bulls into the herd

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Birdie goes on a treacherous hunt to bring home meat for the family and save her chickens from slaughter. Later, Noah constructs an automatic diaper machine

programme.desc: Investigator Stephen Goldman rescues a miniature horse from a neglectful owner and captures two abandoned dogs

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Selina Scott enjoys a gentle walk around Wharfedale in the Yorkshire Dales. Along the way, she learns stories of extraordinary philanthropy, meets walkers and a fisherman, and ends her journey drinking local ale in a pub famed for ferret racing

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.desc: Teams of distinguished graduates compete on behalf of their former universities in the academic quizs festive incarnation, with the opening first-round match seeing SOAS University of London take on Balliol College, Oxford Among those facing questions from host Jeremy Paxman are author and broadcaster Emma Dabiri, and crime writer Martin Edwards

programme.title: The Morecambe and Wise Show
programme.sub-title: Ernie Wise Introduces Morecambe and Wise Classics
programme.desc: Featuring highlights from some of the most successful shows made by the comedic duo. Guest stars are Tom Jones, Des OConnor, Cliff Richard and Diana Rigg. Robin Nash presents. First broadcast 31 December 1987

programme.title: The Morecambe and Wise Show
programme.sub-title: The Morecambe and Wise Show 1970 - The Lost Tape
programme.desc: A complete episode of the comedy duos show that had been considered lost for more than 50 years, but was discovered in an unmarked film can in 2020 by Eric Morecambes son Gary. Now it has been restored and can be enjoyed in full for the first time since being first broadcast on October 8, 1970. Aside from classic sketches, there is music by Paul Anka, Patricia Lambert and Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen, with Eric and Ernie themselves rounding things off with a burst of Bring Me Sunshine

programme.title: The Perfect Morecambe and Wise
programme.desc: Another selection of classic sketches and routines from the double acts shows. The boys re-enact a scene from Singin in the Rain and Eric decides to take on the role of Shakespeares Hamlet. Flora Robson is the virgin queen, Eric goes back to school in Top of the Form, and Cilla Black has good news for Ernie regarding his recording career

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: How tensions came to a head as the investors in the money laundering scam wanted their money out before its mastermind was arrested as, suspecting illegal activity, the bank froze all his assets

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: A look at when the film-makers became aware that not everything was as it seemed. Their collaboration with Amira Smajic was rocked when deleted files were discovered on a recording device she had been wearing

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores the golden age of piracy during the early 18th century, when Captain Kidd, Blackbeard, Calico Jack and others were in operation on the high seas. He charts the devastating impact they had during an era of colonial expansion and how they became the most wanted outlaws in the world by plundering the vast network of maritime trade, they became the most wanted outlaws in the world

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: The Wildest Weather in the Universe: Horizon
programme.desc: Documentary following scientists conducting research into weather on other planets, using unmanned spacecraft to study the solar system and the latest telescopes to examine distant worlds. Their findings have revealed strange phenomena including rains of precious stones, supersonic winds, storms that encompass entire worlds, and temperatures so hot that the clouds are formed of lava

programme.title: Romes Invisible City
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by Dr Michael Scott to explore the underground treasures that made Rome the powerhouse of the ancient world. Using 3D scanning technology, he uncovers the lost subterranean world of the Colosseum, as well as the aqueducts and sewers that supplied and cleansed it, and helped run civilisations first metropolis and its empire

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores the golden age of piracy during the early 18th century, when Captain Kidd, Blackbeard, Calico Jack and others were in operation on the high seas. He charts the devastating impact they had during an era of colonial expansion and how they became the most wanted outlaws in the world by plundering the vast network of maritime trade, they became the most wanted outlaws in the world

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Lemn Sissay walks along ancient drovers roads in Cumbrias Dentdale, meeting locals, including a farmer who collects vintage tractors and a lone bagpiper, and making a challenging climb to Englands highest mainline train station

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University College, Oxford v University of Glasgow
programme.desc: Teams of distinguished graduates from University College, Oxford and the University of Glasgow compete as this festive edition of the academic quiz continues. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as Paul Gambaccini captains the University College team, while author Christopher Brookmyre leads Glasgow

programme.title: Concorde: A Supersonic Story
programme.desc: As new £19million museum Aerospace Bristol prepares to open, this documentary takes a look at the life of the most glamorous plane ever built. Rare footage tells the forgotten row between the French and British governments over the name of Concorde, which threatened to derail the whole project. Engineers, flight technicians and frequent fliers tell the supersonic story, aided by politician Michael Heseltine and actress Joan Collins, while a former passenger recalls sharing an intimate moment with the Rolling Stones. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Being the Brontës
programme.desc: Martha Kearney is joined by author Helen Oyeyemi and journalist Lucy Mangan to immerse themselves in the lives of Charlotte, Emily and Anne Brontë to discover the inspiration behind their classic novels Jane Eyre, Wuthering Heights and Agnes Grey. Travelling to the Haworth Parsonage in West Yorkshire, the trio discover how just two years before their most famous novels were published in 1847, the sisters prospects were bleak. Charlotte was in love with a married man, their clergyman father Patrick was going blind, and their brother, Branwell, was battling alcoholism. However, by 1848, Charlotte, Emily and Anne were literary sensations, and Martha, Helen and Lucy immerse themselves in the personal lives of the sisters to find out how this happened

programme.title: Kay Adshead Remembers - Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Actor, producer and writer Kay Adshead reflects on her portrayal of Cathy Earnshaw in the BBCs 1978 adaptation of Wuthering Heights. She recalls filming on the Yorkshire moors, working alongside Ken Hutchison as Heathcliff, and bringing Emily Brontës storm-swept heroine to life. Kay also talks about the preparation behind the role - the research she undertook, combining the inspiration from earlier portrayals of Cathy with her own individual interpretation

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Five-part dramatisation of the Emily Bronte classic from 1978. Mr Lockwood , the new tenant of Thrushcross Grange, crosses the moors to visit his landlord Heathcliff. What begins as an innocent social visit becomes a night of terror for Lockwood and a journey into the past for Heathcliff

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Five-part dramatisation of the Emily Bronte classic from 1978. Heathcliff is determined on revenge for the ill-treatment he receives from Hindley. He is sustained only by his love for Cathy, a love which is returned

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Three years after his disappearance, a surprise visit from Heathcliff startles the now peacefully-married Cathy. First broadcast 8 October 1978

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Five-part dramatisation of the Emily Bronte classic. Heathcliffe is consumed by grief after Cathys tragic death. First broadcast 15 October 1978

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Heathcliff seeks revenge - he imprisons Catherine at Wuthering Heights, refusing to release her until she marries his ailing son Linton. First broadcast 22 October 1978

programme.title: The Read
programme.desc: Bradford born actor Vinette Robinson performs as the narrator for one of Brontes most loved novels - Wuthering Heights. Seen through the eyes of housekeeper Nelly Dean, the story takes shape around the intense and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw, set against the backdrop of the Yorkshire moors

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: In another special edition for BBC Scam Safe Week, Louise Minchin, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford hear the story of an Edinburgh woman left devastated when an online romance turned out to be a scam

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Tommy Walsh and Martel Maxwell follow developers in Lancashire, Cheshire and Co Durham as they tackle a variety of projects. They explore grand, stone-built offices converted into a nine-bed family home, two flats that were once a pub, and a mid-terrace with a guide price of just £15,000

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp heads to Nottinghamshire, where experts Ben Cooper and Izzie Balmer take the teams antique-hunting before heading to Derby for todays auction. Natasha also discovers how a 16th-century curate revolutionised the world of knitting and tries out his extraordinary invention for herself

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: Im Sorry. I Dont Know What to Do!
programme.desc: Scammers posing as the police target a young carer based in London. If she does not comply with their demands, they say they will arrest her

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Firefighter Lisa wants to become a signwriter in the Scottish Highlands, and blacksmith Menelik is looking for financial security before proposing to his girlfriend

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Powys countryside, helping a couple with two dogs, three cats and a motorbike find a home. He also visits a pioneering farm project growing a greener future

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Clown Ring Toss, Podiatry Charts, Barbers Chair
programme.desc: Nigel Havers meets sellers trying to make a deal on a clown-themed ring toss game, a vintage podiatry poster, an art deco barbers chair and a lovingly restored set of drawers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Fern Fever and Far East Winds
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhurst arrive in Aberdeenshire, where theyre on the hunt for hidden gems and quirky curios. In New Pitsligo, Natasha haggles hard for a piece with Far Eastern flair and takes a chance on an item that falls squarely within Tims field of expertise, while he sniffs out Chinese charm and Victorian oddities

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Angellica Bell and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Oscar makes a shocking discovery, tensions continue to rise in the Slater family, and Anna makes Freddie an offer

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Dawn OPorter, Chris Hughes, Jaki Graham, Jamie Lomas and Michelle Heaton compete to impress judges Grace Dent and John Torode and secure a place in this weeks quarter-final. In the first challenge, the celebrities must prepare a dish based around a mystery ingredient, the likes of which include butter beans, pineapple and smoked haddock. Then they prepare the next street food success story, a dish theyd be happy to serve to the paying public

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: An insight into the work of frontline staff in Yorkshire. Every second counts as critical care paramedic Zach tries to stabilise an 11-year-old boy who has been seriously injured in a multi-car collision. Leeds-based crew Ryan and Tom are called to a man who is struggling to breathe, and are then dispatched to an 89-year-old who has collapsed to the floor overnight in a state of confusion. A call handler deals with a woman who has been repeatedly jamming the phone lines with no real emergency - but this time her symptoms trigger a category one response, the highest level for life-threatening situations

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Big Banana Feet
programme.desc: The long-lost film of Billy Connollys 1975 tour of Ireland captures The Big Yin both on and off stage, and provides a captivating record of the future comedy legend on the cusp of international stardom

programme.title: The Idea of You
programme.desc: Forty-year-old gallery owner and single mother Solène takes her daughter to a music festival, where she crosses paths with 24-year-old singer Hayes - the lead singer of a world-famous boy band - and the two begin a whirlwind romance. But the couple soon find themselves at the centre of a social media storm when fans of the band discover Hayes is dating an older woman. Romance, starring Anne Hathaway and Nicholas Galitzine. Based on the novel by Robinne Lee

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Help! Is My Online Job a Scam?
programme.desc: BBC Scam Safe Week continues with the team helping a viewer concerned that the online task work he has been completing might not be genuine. They also have an update on an undercover report into a dodgy spray-foam insulation firm, and how their footage helped put the man responsible behind bars

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph, Martel Maxwell and Tommy Walsh visit a bungalow in Cambridgeshire undergoing a £250,000 renovation, an end terrace in Cumbria bought for £35,000 at auction and a one-bed flat in central London thats due a high-end makeover

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Irita Marriott help two teams buy items to sell in Naseby, Northamptonshire. Christina Trevanion checks out a collection of football programmes

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: The Most Appalling Identity Theft Weve Ever Seen
programme.desc: Ethical hacker Jim Browning wins the team access to a new fraudulent call centre, where criminals are currently stealing one mans passwords and email addresses

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Textile waste upcycler Rukhsana wants to turn her hobby into a business but lacks the confidence to promote herself. Her mentor Zoe and Dom Chinea set her the biggest challenge theyve ever given any maker. Electrician Jan wants to swap his day job for a stone-carving career but needs help building the business that will allow him to switch careers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a buyer to return to her childhood home county of Devon, and visits an organic orchard producing award-winning cider

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Marble Bust, Diving Boots, Ventriloquist Puppet
programme.desc: The dealers are confronted by a pair of antique diving boots, a ventriloquists puppet who appeared on stage and screen in the 1960s and 1970s and an original 1970s Chopper bicycle

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhurst continues their antiques hunt in Perthshire and Tayside. In Dundee, Natasha uncovers a mysterious Canadian landscape that piques her curiosity, while Tim falls for a humble bit of country pottery. In Pitlochry, the pair get crafty with a quintessential Scottish plant, transforming it into tiny polished treasures

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Anita Rani

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Vernon Kay host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren wrestles with a difficult decision, Anthony supports Zoe, and Ian and Elaines feud intensifies

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Todays guest judge is Michelin-trained chef Poppy OToole, who challenges contestants Dawn OPorter, Chris Hughes, Jaki Graham, Jamie Lomas and Michelle Heaton to recreate one of her favourite dishes, each of which contains an element of potato - Poppys favourite ingredient. After that, they are tasked with serving up a two-course dinner party menu to secure their place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: On a mission to find out the identity of the Callaghans contact in Shetland, Calder piles the pressure on Louden. He reluctantly agrees, but ultimately ends up in grave danger. Stevie is elated to have her sister Amy all to herself, but her mood sours when Calder asks her to come in for further questioning. Sandy tells Tosh that he believes Robert Tulloch was a corrupt police officer. Aware that the revelation will unsettle Billy, Tosh decides to secretly investigate further

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Rewarding
programme.desc: One-off comedy about Francis and Sinead, colleagues navigating their first shift together in Mid-Ulsters social care system. They both want the best for their clients - they just have very different ideas on how to do it. Starring Seána Kerslake and Vittorio Angelone

programme.title: Helpless
programme.desc: New wheelchair user Cillian is bored and becomes obsessed with Grace, the curious girl in the flat upstairs. Convinced her boyfriend Joe is mistreating her, he risks everything to be Graces hero - only to uncover dangerous secrets. Standalone comedy, starring George Robinson, Saoirse-Monica Jackson and Éanna Hardwicke

programme.title: Mourning Glory
programme.desc: Lost soul Dermot is newly widowed and as a way of numbing his pain he attends every funeral across Antrim. . But his gate-crashing habit doesnt go unnoticed as the new funeral director catches him in the act - but then makes him an offer he surely cant refuse. One-off comedy, starring Nigel ONeill and Amy Huberman

programme.title: MOTD: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Action from the matchday five fixtures, including Arsenal v Bayern Munich at Emirates Stadium, Paris Saint-Germain v Tottenham Hotspur at Parc des Princes and Chelsea v Barcelona at Stamford Bridge. Arsenal and Bayern both went into their match boasting a 100 per cent record so far and PSG and Spurs met in a repeat of the UEFA Super Cup, while the Blues and Barca were looking for wins to move towards the top eight

programme.title: Tell Me Lies
programme.desc: Lucy and Bree attend a professors Christmas party, while Lucy makes a rash decision that affects Pippa

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus reveals daily routines throughout history, from waking in Ancient Egypt to Medieval Loo Man

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Comedian and former psychiatric nurse Jo Brand joins Rattus to host a special episode in honour of the NHSs 75th birthday

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Amanda Holden joins the team for a special episode for Scam Safe Week, in which she helps them go after the criminals who used her name and image to con victims out of thousands. Using the same remote access tech scammers rely on, the team will hack the hackers to monitor their operations in real time, before confronting the fraudsters, and stopping scams before they happen

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Documentary following boxer Tommy Furys return to the ring. Tommy is at his lowest point personally and professionally, living alone in a house that was meant to be his and partner Molly-Maes forever home. His role as a father to baby Bambi brings both joy and pressure as he tries to convince Molly-Mae he is a changed man. After finally getting the medical all-clear to fight again, Tommy and his trainer and father John prepare for his return to the ring against MMA fighter Darren Till. Team Fury travels to the press conference - with John promising to be on his best behaviour

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy prepares for his first gym appearance since announcing his comeback, but with fighter Darren Till throwing threats and chaos into the mix, trainer John pulls Tommy out of the fight claiming he is unwilling to risk his sons future career. Its a crushing blow for Tommy, whos desperate for momentum and purpose. Amid the pressure, theres a flicker of hope - Tommy and partner Molly-Mae Hague are spotted together on New Years Eve, with a kiss that hints at a brighter future

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys fight for redemption continues, but this time, its a battle for his own mind. Struggling to secure a new opponent, he knows a comeback fight is crucial for his mental health. Meanwhile, Molly-Maes new series trailer drops, pushing Tommy to face his own truths in the toughest interview of his life, where he opens up about his battle with alcohol addiction. Back in training, hope returns as a potential fight looms, leading him and his father John to a career-defining meeting

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy is hopeful that he could be fighting again soon, and he and Molly-Mae are spending more time together. Then, disaster strikes when KSI cancels the night when Roman was due to be in the fighting, claiming illness. John is furious, but decides the boys need cheering up so tells them he is taking them on a camping trip. However, neither Tommy nor Roman share their fathers love of the outdoors

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy heads to Budapest to close the deal for the fight, but theres a hitch. With just four weeks to go, John calls the deal off because the money hasnt reached Tommys account

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Its Tommys birthday, but theres no time for cake. With just days to go before his long-awaited comeback fight in Budapest, Tommy is pulled in every direction - juggling press conferences, promo shoots and the pressure of proving hes still got what it takes in the ring

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy heads to Budapest to close the deal for the fight, but theres a hitch. With just four weeks to go, John calls the deal off because the money hasnt reached Tommys account

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Its Tommys birthday, but theres no time for cake. With just days to go before his long-awaited comeback fight in Budapest, Tommy is pulled in every direction - juggling press conferences, promo shoots and the pressure of proving hes still got what it takes in the ring

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From warring brothers to farting mothers, Horrible Histories presents some of the biggest, best and worst rivalries throughout time. Guest starring Rosie Jones, Fred Sirieix and Rob Rinder

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From how Henry VIII had the most comfortable poo possible, to finding out which bit of his house Charles Dickens called the Demon - take a tour of horrible homes through history.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. Theres also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and former Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor

programme.title: The Idea of You
programme.desc: Forty-year-old gallery owner and single mother Solène takes her daughter to a music festival, where she crosses paths with 24-year-old singer Hayes - the lead singer of a world-famous boy band - and the two begin a whirlwind romance. But the couple soon find themselves at the centre of a social media storm when fans of the band discover Hayes is dating an older woman. Romance, starring Anne Hathaway and Nicholas Galitzine. Based on the novel by Robinne Lee

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Aherns novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: How a 16-year-old used his job in a call centre in Glasgow to go on a five-year crime wave, defrauding innocent cardholders and laying the groundwork for a life of wealth, first-class travel and an escape from the life he was destined for

Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the worlds largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form puffin patrols to rescue the pufflings. Lars is excited to help out but is upset when he discovers Glitch, also a fan of puffins, is already well-known on the islands for his skills as a puffin rescuer. Although Glitch offers him a place in his puffin patrol, Lars is determined to outdo Glitch with a patrol of his own - but when he recruits a clumsy Grimbot, things take a turn for the worse...

programme.desc: The Go Jetters are in Australia, exploring the Wolfe Creek Crater, also known as Kandimalal. But soon he has competition in the form of Glitch, who races Foz to find an object that both of their metal detectors pick up - which turns out to be a rusty spoon! In the end, neither of them manage to find any pieces of meteorite, prompting Glitch to send the Grimbots to drag a huge space rock to Earth to help him! Can the Go Jetters prevent this huge disaster before its too late?

Are any of them good enough for Roger and Paolo to put in an offer?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Modern bureaucracy threatens to halt Louise and Pauls rebuild of a collapsed 300 year-old wall in France and in Italy, an emergency repair pushes Ivano and Traceys renovation schedule even further behind. A precarious ancient roof structure concerns custodians Becci and Micheal in Portugal

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Summerwater
programme.desc: A big blowout forces the residents to finally come face to face and resolve their differences. But just as the mood shifts to euphoric highs, tragedy strikes and theres a mighty fall. As intense divides form and unlikely bonds are made, the residents must work together - and a death in camp leaves the holiday-makers grappling with their guilt and searching for someone to blame

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the sex trafficker, being told over three nights, beginning by delving into her lavish childhood in the shadow of a tyrannical father and examining if this affected the woman she was to become. Her fathers death left the family penniless and ostracised, but Ghislaines move to New York in the early 1990s, and association with a mysterious money manager, enabled her to make a new start. But at what price?

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the shocking contrast between the incredible wealth and power wielded by Ghislaine Maxwell and her partner Jeffrey Epstein in American high society, and the crimes they were committing behind closed doors. They entertained presidents and princes in fabulous properties and on a private island. But there are those who claim Maxwell enticed them into that world only to feed Epsteins sexual aberrations

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: This instalment of the documentary charts events in the steady demise of Ghislaine Maxwell. The socialite narrowly escaped an initial police investigation into the sexual abuse of dozens of underage girls in Epsteins Florida mansion. However, her subsequent rehabilitation as an environmentalist was scuppered when she went on the offensive against an accuser. Lawyers of survivors explain their innovative strategy that forced Ghislaine into a corner. It initiated a domino effect that eventually led to an ultimate reckoning - at the criminal trial that found her guilty in December 2021

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by Harriet Kemsley and Katherine Ryan for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: The Serpent Queen
programme.desc: King Henri sets off to lead an army defending France, and puts Catherine in charge as regent in his absence, which gives her an opportunity to further test her powers. Diane insists on accompanying Henri to the front lines. But when Henri sends word to Catherine that supplies are running low and more funds are needed, the privy council refuses to help her

programme.title: The Serpent Queen

After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. Finally, laid-back Jenny and Jack at Banh Mi show off their pan-Asian plates in their trendy underground restaurant. Their guests are captivated by their authentic food, but can Jack and Jenny hold on to their relaxed reputation and win over the table?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth jets off to Spain to help childhood sweethearts Sue and Albert from Chatham, Kent, find their perfect holiday home. The pair first discovered Benalmadena on the Costa del Sol five years ago and instantly fell in love with it, so much so that theyve been back 10 times and now intend to buy a holiday home where they can spend time with their family. Lee lines up five great options for their budget of £190,000. Will Sue and Albert love any of them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Ivano and Tracey deal with more damage to the ancient fragile structures in their trulli village and Louise and Paul uncover more of their 300 year-old Hamlets past. Liz and Dave fight to keep their resurrected ghost holiday village alive

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: Breakfast causes tempers to flare in Nichola and Roys kitchen, Jacqui and Rob fail to learn from their mistakes and Michelle is faced with the challenge of cooking a three-course meal - only for her curdled curry leave a bad taste with the judges

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Therapists Bernie and Vernon, who first met 15 years ago, are searching for their perfect holiday home on the Canary Island of Fuerteventura. They love travelling, and although Vernons never actually been to Fuerteventura before, theyre convinced its the perfect place for their holiday home. Sara Damergi shows them the best of what their £150,000 budget can buy; will any of her options hit the mark?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Analysis of todays Budget, announced this afternoon by Chancellor Rachel Reeves. Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Luke Charters, MP for Outer York, discusses Labours plan to reduce antisocial behaviour and to make Britains high streets safer

programme.title: Grand Designs: House of the Year
programme.desc: On the Kent coast, a contemporary home makes the beach itself part of everyday life, blending work with an endless sense of escape. In east London, a landlocked plot is transformed into a sun-filled sanctuary, precisely angled to catch every ray while shutting out the city around it. In suburban Surrey, a burst of tropical colour, terracotta and greenery conjures the Caribbean. In London, a calm retreat draws on Japanese traditions, with timber frames and courtyards that blur the line between house and garden. In Wiltshire, soaring rooflines stretch outwards to frame vast views of cathedral spires and meadows. California comes to south London in the form of a dazzling American-style glass and steel home. Each house offers an experience like no other. But only the best will earn a place on the shortlist

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A 65-year-old woman is rushed to Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham after being found collapsed in the park. Domestic cleaner Deanna, a long-serving member of the AandE team, shares her struggles in early life, including overcoming addiction, before finding her purpose working in the hospital. The doctors treat a teenager with a burn on her hand

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The Essex crew and Herts Air Ambulance race to help a teenager, who has a major brain injury after colliding with a car in Hemel Hempstead. In Bicester, Dimis heart is racing dangerously fast and needs to be shocked back into a normal rhythm and in Clacton, some DIY goes wrong for Martin, who has a suspected broken collarbone

programme.title: Britains Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: In the Vale of Glamorgan, agents Sorcha Rodbard-Hedderwick and Jemma Friday are marketing £2.2 million Llwynhelig House - a Grade II-listed manor featuring a log cabin and shepherds hut. Broker Margaret Thompson is in Jersey to showcase £17 million Sunningdale Manor, which has undergone a multimillion-pound renovation. In London, agent Constance Cunningham presents three high-end apartments to Argentinian lawyer Ramiro, and in Cornwall, Ian Lillicrap returns to the charming village of Flushing, where hes been called to value a 16th-century house that hes sold twice before

programme.title: Outrageous Homes
programme.desc: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen meets Trevor, whos 86 and has dedicated decades to creating his very own Venetian palazzo in Staines, from plunging light wells to vaulted ceilings and lavish waterways. On the Isle of Wight, Laurence takes a trip to Poppys kawaii home of ice-cream lights, doughnut sprinkles and cotton candy walls. The interior design expert also meets Sonia, whos been both thrifty and nifty in her maximalist mini mansion

programme.title: Summerwater
programme.desc: The picture-perfect Henderson family try to repair broken trust, despite resistance from a rebellious teen daughter, who tries to find out more about Summerwater and its secrets. programme.desc: The work of trailblazing scientists taking on the disease, exploring how their pioneering work is changing patients lives right now. This programme focuses on Professor Sarah Blagden, who is attempting to stop cancer before it even starts. Her pioneering clinical trials feature Trevor, a retired Navy veteran whose skin cancer has spread. Could Sarahs immunotherapy trial save Trevors life? Twenty six-year-old Ella has a genetic condition giving her a 90 per cent chance of developing cancer. Ella hopes to join Sarahs prevention trial and live without fear

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Kate Williams explores the history of Sandringham in Norfolk, which is one of the few royal residences owned personally by the Windsors. It was purchased in 1861 for the rakish Prince Edward in the hopes he would settle down in the countryside, but instead he turned it into the perfect party palace, with a bowling alley, billiards and endless hunting and shooting. The historian also reveals how Prince Philip once proposed demolishing the place to make way for a more modern replacement, before being forced to relent by the Queen Mother

programme.desc: Beverly tries to find Pops a person to settle down with, and sets him up on a date with a woman called Sophia who seems to fit his demanding criteria. Meanwhile, Adam and Barry bond over their discovery of a new TV channel. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: The Butlers and Johnsons are rattled in different ways after an earthquake strikes, with Calvin and Tina moving in with Malcolm and Marty while their home is repaired

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When there is a break-in at Calvins business, he teams up with Dave for a stakeout to catch the culprit. Gemma is uncharacteristically reluctant to share her new hobby with Tina

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the Big Little Leagues
programme.desc: Calvin and Malcolm butt heads on coaching styles as Malcolms little league team approaches its first game of the season. And Tina tries to win over a food critic

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren tries his best to support Mercedes, but his scorned ex-girlfriend is never far away. Guilt consumes one resident, Frankie opens up about her past, and a new mum continues to struggle

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna, Dodger and the McQueens step in to help new mum Cleo as she finally gets the support she needs. The Osbornes get to know Frankies new beau. And new resident Gemma tries to build bridges with Mercedes

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos featuring sheep

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Rosaria bought Bella Luna to realise her son Gianfrancos ambition to become a chef, but the Italian restaurants future looks bleak due to his lack of experience in the kitchen combined with her refusal to acknowledge the eaterys many flaws. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Bostons La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge encourages Bart to explore his creative side and signs him up for piano lessons, but the youngster is less than enthusiastic about the prospect until he meets his Russian teacher Zhenya. Meanwhile, Homer is distraught after losing his last two hairs and becoming completely bald. Guest starring the voices of Jane Krakowski, Bill Hader and Justin Bieber

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer, Moe and Lenny go in pursuit of Carl when he skips town with $200,000 in winnings from a lottery ticket he bought with them. However, their search makes them realise how little they know about their friend and almost reaches a dead-end until Lisa points them in the direction of Iceland. Featuring music by Sigur Ros

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon discovers a surprise screening of The Avengers is scheduled at a local cinema, complete with a QandA session with the films director, Joss Whedon. However, the event just happens to clash with time hed planned to spend with Amy, so he decides to pay Stuart to be his subtitute for the afternoon while he and the other boys immerse themselves in Marvel superheroics. Meanwhile, Leonards mother Beverly arrives in town for an extended visit, and Penny takes the opportunity to bond with her new mother-in-law - and to make up for not inviting her to the wedding. Comedy, guest starring Christine Baranski

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Conflict arises when Leonards newly divorced parents and Sheldons devoutly religious mother are all in town at the same time. And when Howard and Raj are contacted about the guidance system theyve developed, they assume that the government is out to get them. Laurie Metcalf, Christine Baranski and Judd Hirsch guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. Cameron, however, takes it just a little step too far. The Dunphys, meanwhile, have been enjoying a relaxing summer without smart-alec Alex, who is away on a trip - although she threatens to rock the boat after arriving home early - and Gloria shows a different side after arguing with Jay about the lack of effort he puts into his appearance

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria celebrate their anniversary, but cannot decide on what kind of gift to give each other. Meanwhile, the Dunphys join Alex on her college tour and Phil, Luke and Haley find themselves in a mirrored waiting room with a button and a sign that says Do Not Push. Comedy, starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon returns to Texas in disgrace when he discovers his friends tampered with the Arctic expedition data after growing tired of his quest for a scientific breakthrough. Elsewhere, Leonard becomes frustrated as constant interruptions hamper his attempts to woo Penny

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon succeeds in getting Penny to conform to his high standards, so Leonard adopts a similar strategy for his romantic gain. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj meet two women at a goth nightclub and things appear to go well - until they are taken to a tattoo parlour

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj accepts Sheldons offer to work for him as he is desperate to avoid being sent back to India. Howard starts spending more time with Leonard and Penny, who would rather be left alone. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Dolomite, Apple Slices and a Mystery Woman
programme.desc: Sheldon makes friends with an upper-class senior pupil who introduces him to a new field of science. Meanwhile, Mary and George disagree on how to handle Sheldons blossoming social life

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Killer Asteroids, Oklahoma and a Frizzy Hair Machine
programme.desc: A disappointing lack of success in a competition at the school science fair sends Sheldons life in a new direction as he rejects the idea of becoming a scientist in favour of acting. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more family more cultured than her own

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Im Dancing as Fat as I Can
programme.desc: Homer angers Marge by binge-watching their favourite show on his own and has to pick up a new skill to make amends. Meanwhile, Bart prepares to compete in Krustys Holiday Trample

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon invites a famous physicist to the flat after befriending her online, but is put out to find Leonard showing an interest in her. Meanwhile, Penny has to confront her ex-boyfriend when the visitor turns up in his bedroom. Guest starring Judy Greer (Glenn Martin, DDS)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The comedy flashes back to reveal how Sheldon saved the lives of his pals, and looks at the origins of his friendship with Leonard seven years previously, as well as explaining the housemates agreement. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj and Howard register Sheldon with an online dating site hoping to find his perfect female equivalent. Meanwhile, a drunk Penny seduces Leonard, but regrets it the next day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco. Mayim Bialik makes her first appearance on the show

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howards new robotic arm creates problems

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart joins an organisation called the Junior Campers and asks Homer to come on a father-son rafting expedition. Unfortunately, the pair soon find themselves adrift on the open sea - with only Ned Flanders and his children for company. With the voice of Ernest Borgnine

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer falls for a sexy colleague and tries to avoid her, fearing he may be unable to resist temptation. However, Mr Burns sends the two of them on a business trip together and the enforced intimacy puts an intolerable strain on his willpower. Featuring the guest voice of Michelle Pfeiffer

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes and Ste find themselves on a path of self-destruction while the McQueens support Sienna - but drama soon follows

programme.title: Animal Control
programme.desc: Frank and Emily make a breakthrough in their exotic animal ring case. Shred and Rick bond over their romantic woes. Victoria and Patels father accidentally kiss

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: Tyra Banks challenges the remaining girls to meet and greet members of the public, in a bid to prepare them for fame. Monique quickly grows bored while Kasia basks in her notoriety, and later wins a dinner with judge Miss J. Alexandria is challenged yet again for her over-enthusiasm at a photoshoot, which she worries will be criticised by the panel.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on various show from the past week, including Michael McIntyres The Wheel, Jamies £1 Wonders, Top Gear, Guillermo del Toros Cabinet of Curiosities, Drink Masters, Wild Croc Territory, plus the woman marrying a ghost on This Morning and BBC News reporting on the-then new 50p coin. First shown in November 2022

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The regular gaggle of family and friends appraise Im a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, Hollyoaks, Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy, Queens for the Night, Alexander Armstrong In South Korea, University Challenge, and the BBC news coverage of Cop 27

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Lawyer and painter Josh sits down for a meal with student and part-time waitress Sophia, while Old Etonian Leslie and blogger Babs bond over a shared respect of Michelle Obama. Property developer Amanda is ready to begin dating again after her husband passed away, but she and sales executive Brad both have the distinct feeling they may have met before, while Sue returns to the restaurant after nerves got the better of her during her first visit

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Pennys living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny celebrate Valentines Day, but their evening takes a turn for the worse when the latters ex-boyfriend proposes to his girlfriend in the same restaurant. Meanwhile, Sheldon enlists the help of his assistant Alex to find the perfect gift for Amy

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on various show from the past week, including Michael McIntyres The Wheel, Jamies £1 Wonders, Top Gear, Guillermo del Toros Cabinet of Curiosities, Drink Masters, Wild Croc Territory, plus the woman marrying a ghost on This Morning and BBC News reporting on the-then new 50p coin. programme.desc: Beverly confronts her husband after discovering her engagement ring is the same one Murray gave to his former fiancee. programme.title: Payroll
programme.desc: The widow of an armoured car driver swears revenge on the criminals who killed him - leading them to turn on each other. Crime drama, starring Michael Craig and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: A six-year-old boy from Londons East End is fascinated by the stories of an elderly neighbour, who tells him about the strange powers of the mythical unicorn. The lad sets out to find such a magical beast, only to encounter a single-horned goat. Certain he has found the creature he was looking for, he takes it home - and sets about trying to make wishes come true. Drama, with Jonathan Ashmore, Celia Johnson, Diana Dors and David Kossoff

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: A German racketeer risks his life to rescue a kidnapped British girl from communists in post-war Berlin and escort her back to safety - but is forced to make a tremendous sacrifice to ensure her survival. Drama, starring James Mason, Claire Bloom, Hildegarde Neff, Geoffrey Toone, Aribert Waescher and Ernst Schroeder

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: Three convicts plot to sneak out of prison, steal a fortune in diamonds from a maharajah, and then creep back in to provide themselves with the perfect alibi. However, their seemingly flawless plan is threatened by the arrival of a strict new prison officer. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson as a one-time geek who suffered constant humiliation at high school but grew up to be a lethal CIA agent. But when he is targeted by his own organisation, he comes home for a high school reunion, where he enlists the help of the former campus tough guy - now a meek accountant - who very quickly wonders what he has got himself into. Co-starring Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: A cops career is seemingly over when he accidentally shoots a hostage while thwarting a bank robbery. He is given the chance to redeem himself by joining an elite unit headed by a veteran sergeant. Their mission is to escort an international crime lord in custody as he is taken to prison. However, they hit a snag when their prisoner offers a multimillion-dollar reward to anyone who breaks him out of jail, placing them under attack from every criminal in the city. Action thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson and Colin Farrell

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: A ruthless London crime lord tries to extend his dockland empire by exploring business opportunities in America. When his organisation is the target of a series of bombings, he discovers a mysterious syndicate is trying to muscle in on his territory, and resorts to increasingly brutal methods to expose the culprits. Gritty thriller, starring Bob Hoskins, Helen Mirren, Dave King and Bryan Marshall, with Pierce Brosnan and former Casualty star Derek Thompson in supporting roles

programme.title: Chopper
programme.desc: Fact-based Australian drama charting the rise and fall of notorious criminal Mark Chopper Read, based on events described in his best-selling autobiographical books, some of which he wrote while serving a jail sentence for murder. Starring Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field, Daniel Wyllie and Bill Young

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pals fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inges Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: The Blue Lamp
programme.desc: A veteran policeman gives a new recruit the benefit of his experience, while two crooks plan a series of robberies. When the two duos meet, the older constable is shot and killed, and his protege sets out to bring the killers to justice. Police drama, starring Jack Warner in a role he would reprise for TV series Dixon of Dock Green. With Jimmy Hanley and Dirk Bogarde

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta

programme.title: xXx
programme.desc: Extreme sports star Xander Cage finds himself in trouble when his daredevil exploits land him behind bars. However, he is offered an intriguing escape route, courtesy of National Security Agent Augustus Gibbons - who thinks the adrenaline junkie is the perfect man to bring down a gang of international terrorists in Prague. Action adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Samuel L Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas and Michael Roof.

programme.title: xXx: The Next Level
programme.desc: The American secretary of defence forms a covert military organisation with the intention of assassinating the president. A government spymaster is ready to foil the plot but, since his top agent is dead, he has to recruit an imprisoned soldier to help him. Action sequel, starring Ice Cube, Samuel L Jackson and Willem Dafoe

Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Elsa Martinelli and Lon Chaney Jr

programme.title: The Indian Fighter
programme.desc: A scout hired to steer a wagon train through Sioux territory hopes to maintain good relations with local tribespeople. However, the actions of a few foolhardy hotheads in the convoy endanger the fragile peace, and a planned robbery threatens to spark an all-out war. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Elsa Martinelli and Lon Chaney Jr

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: An inexperienced farmer takes over land near the Cannons. However, his herd becomes diseased and his failure to deal with the crisis threatens the Cannons own animals

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of strangers, including a drunken doctor, a pregnant army officers wife and an embezzling bank clerk, embarks on a dangerous journey across hostile territory. They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Fords Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Several convicts escape and seek revenge on Joshs prisoner for sending them to jail. Western drama, starring Steve McQueen

programme.desc: Whilst the Baron is doing his best to copy Eddies mannerisms, a close friend of the deceased spots the deception. The gang now force Mannering to help them steal the Crown Jewels

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.desc: David is arrested as Bethany remains unconscious in hospital. Gail washes her hands of her son and tells him to pack his bags and go, while Hayley and Roy drift further apart.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey comes to Davids aid and pleads with Gail not to give up on her son. Hayley tells Roy she wants to see Christian again and Liam is curious about Carlas new friend.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin head to London for Martin to present his research paper and Janice is looking after the children - but things dont go smoothly when Penhale tries to help. Martin also has a few hiccups along the way, including an unexpected proposition or two

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Continuing the final series of the hospital drama after a two-year break. Susie Dixons head is turned by a rich playboy, with devastating consequences for Mrs Middleditch when the negligent nurse administers the wrong blood during a transfusion. Ormerod is called out by the coastguard to rescue a grieving widow who has got into difficulty on her yacht, and Jack and Alun find themselves looking after a horse after it tramples its owner. Robert Daws, Sarah Beck Mather, Susan Hampshire and Gareth Hale star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Steve Crane takes an urgent phone call, and is shocked to discover Peter Pykes warehouse has gone up in smoke. It soon emerges that the owners wife had spent time behind bars for fraud, and her husband is reluctant to answer questions - leading Merton to suspect the blaze was deliberate. Meanwhile, Vernon moves into his new mansion, but has trouble keeping up with his well-to-do neighbours. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Liz Merrick faces a trying time when one of her patients misses an appointment to discuss medication, and subsequently ends up charged with drink-driving, while Vernons pal David is kidnapped and held to ransom. Merton is delighted Jenny has agreed to marry him, and Bellamy finds out that Gina is carrying his baby. Rural drama, starring Aislin McGuckin, Geoffrey Hughes and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy punches Daz when Scarlett insinuates the pair have slept together. Edna becomes suspicious of Eli and Lilys new alliance after he delivers a package to their house.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Debbie seems to have an ulterior motive when she comforts an upset Scarlett and Viv emotionally manipulates the villagers into giving money to her charity.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: An apprehensive David returns home to collect his belongings, and Gail makes it clear hes not welcome any more. Hayley tells Becky she has decided to come clean with Christian.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Hayley plucks up the courage to tell Christian his father is still alive when he asks to see Harolds grave, and Audrey comes under fire for supporting David.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tom and Sybbie return to Downton, but the peace is disrupted by an unexpected visit from an old friend. Baxter is faced with a dilemma after an encounter with Sergeant Willis, while Thomas struggles to fill Carsons shoes. Anna goes to London with Mary to deal with a crisis, while her secrets seem likely to be exposed. Daisy is not happy with Cora, and Mary has an admirer

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The news of Martins Imperial College job offer goes flying through the village, but the Ellinghams are yet to make a decision. Caitlin blames Bert for the flooded pub cellar, and an emergency on the rocks helps Morwenna make some important decisions

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An old friend of Merton is sent from CID to help track down a bank robber, and he agrees to be best man at the wedding, while Jennys disgraced brother Steve tries to patch things up with his sister before she ties the knot. Events conspire to jeopardise the special day and stop the happy couple making it to the church on time. Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey, Mark Jordon and Tricia Penrose star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress goes in search of a bogus water board official who has been robbing the elderly, but ends up investigating a suspicious death linked to one of the burglaries. Meanwhile, Blaketon seeks to rectify a miscarriage of justice by reviving a pre-war darts tournament between the Aidensfield Arms and the White Lion, and Gina begins to get cold feet about her impending marriage to Phil. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.sub-title: The Memory of Water - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The green-fingered amateur sleuths are drawn into another mystery when a barrister employing them to spruce up his garden discovers his cousin has been drowned, only for the man to be spotted alive and well a few days later. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope is called to the scene when the body of addiction support worker Angela Konan is found hidden among the bleak woodlands of Northumberland National Park. Vera and her team must peel back the layers of the introverted victims life to uncover her closely guarded secrets and surprising depths, as It appears an increasingly erratic Angela clashed with two clients in the week before she died. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A barmaids murder leads Lewis (Kevin Whately) and Hathaway (Laurence Fox) to a respected professor, who admits he once had an affair with the woman. However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence

programme.desc: Dr Merrick is called out to a remote farmhouse, where she discovers three children have been left orphaned by the death of their father. programme.desc: A student production of The Merchant of Venice is halted when the actor playing Shylock is murdered during the performance. Using a budget of £400,000 Jasmine Harman goes all out flying the flag for north Devon, while Jonnie Irwin tempts them with some stunning properties in France

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance. Joining her are tough-talking prison transport officer Tina, dreadlocked farm-dweller Stephen, superior IT manager David and glamorous beauty-school teacher Ashleigh. Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. Julie overcooks her beef, but will her hosting make up for it and bag her the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the weeks parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone elses food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final evening of gatherings in Co Durham sees IT manager David stage a French-themed soiree in the hope of securing the £1,000 prize. However, he soon finds his main challenge is to keep all his guests on friendly terms

programme.desc: Former international rugby union player Brian Robinson welcomes guests to Manse on the Beach in Cloughey, Co Down, where sea views and an onsite sauna prove a hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Secret Garden Glamping in Skelmersdale, Lancashire, but guests feel hemmed in by their hideaway and yearn for a communal connection

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Walkeringham in Nottinghamshire, and Hawthorn Hideaway, owned by partners Ronnie and Jo Lee. Theyre hoping that their relaxing, adults-only accommodation will be loved by all. Guests Derry and Mike are delighted by the decor, and Shaun and Hollie are stunned by a surprise, but things dont quite add up for Brian. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Gloucestershire, wine connoisseur Adam plans an evening full of posh plonk, excellent etiquette and fine dining. However, with some rowdy guests and one in particular choosing to overshare about their wind problems, Adams got a challenge on his hands if he wants to maintain decorum. When his dessert falls foul of a custard catastrophe, he decides to pull out a less-than-riveting party trick

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cycling enthusiast Steve hosts the third dinner party of the week in Gloucestershire, hoping to impress his guests with a menu inspired by his travels

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the last night in Gloucestershire, hairdresser Lorna hopes an American 50s diner-style menu will be a success. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlottes old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Visitor Mike presents the engagement and wedding rings he designed for his late wife Sarah. His daughter is now nearing her 21st birthday, and Mike would love her to have her mothers rings as a birthday gift. Goldsmith Richard Talman excels himself to get these broken, bent and faded pieces back to their sparkling best. An old-fashioned penny slot machine and a wooden writing box are also restored

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore uses her salvaging expertise at Witley Recycling Centre to search for three items that she can clean up and reinvent. To help her, she calls on trusty makers Leigh-Anne Treadwell and Duncan McKean. Leigh-Anne takes on two wingback armchairs in need of a makeover, while lighting expert Duncan has some retro lampshades to contend with. Sarah herself sees potential in an extendable dining table

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell revisit the stories of three people navigating new relationships and complicated feelings, including ex-footballer Dominic Matteo, who was desperate to find his birth mother after being diagnosed with a brain tumour. Grant Williams returns to Derry to spend more time with his daughter Wendy OHagan to make the most of their time together in light of his recent diagnosis of Alzheimers, while Colin Deering - who first met his brother Bryan back in 2014 - starts out on a new journey to find out about his birth father

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House

programme.desc: A surprise find in a clients garden has Anguss team stunned, but will a big silver key unlock a generous donation to a worthy charity?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Philip Serrell and Stephanie Connell head to an auction in Hamilton. Steph comes across a chic French sign, but Phil is distracted by the local cuisine

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House

programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the stories of foundlings as they search for answers about why they were left as babies and try to find their birth families. A police detective left on church steps as a baby, who has been unable to solve the mystery of his own identity, finally discovers the truth. Elsewhere, a woman left in a hospital in the 1960s receives surprising news about her birth family

programme.desc: Down-and-out stuntman Colt Seavers sets out to find the missing star of his ex-girlfriends blockbuster. Action comedy based on Lee Majors 1980s TV series, starring Ryan Gosling, Emily Blunt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Hannah Waddingham

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: In a post-apocalyptic world, a kidnapped girl grows into a warrior who seeks vengeance against a great biker horde led by the crazed Dementus. Director George Millers Mad Max: Fury Road prequel, starring Anya Taylor-Joy, Chris Hemsworth and Tom Burke

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Environmental activists hijack an energy companys gala in Canary Wharf and take 300 hostages and an ex-soldier now working as a window cleaner tries to rescue them. Action thriller, starring Daisy Ridley. Action thriller, starring Daisy Ridley and Clive Owen

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz
