programme.desc: A woman fights for her life after being knifed by her former partner, while a teenager on her way to seeing two YouTube stars in a live appearance is felled by a falling tree

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Paramedic Kim climbs into a crushed car balanced over a fast-flowing river, while services across the Pennines are paralysed when a man plunges from a bridge onto a busy rail line

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes is asked to consult on the case of a Wall Street banker who appears to have overdosed on heroin, with work-related stress and a misguided experiment being two possible explanations for the victims drug use. Meanwhile, Watson tackles the dating game. Detective drama, starring Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 22-year-old woman goes into labour with her first child, and complications arise for a 37-year-old expectant mother. Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients through the joys and sorrows of becoming parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The pressure becomes too much for one prospective father when midwives decide his girlfriend needs a Caesarean. Meanwhile, a diabetic mother-to-be anxiously waits to go into labour after being induced, and her frustration is exacerbated when her hospital lunch fails to arrive on time

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley meets five sisters in Lancashire who only found each other as adults. They know they all share the same mother, but want to find out if they also have the same father. Luke was a sperm donor as a university student in the late 1980s. He has now come forward to find out if any potential children might be looking for him. Identical twins Diane and Louise want to test their DNA to discover if they both carry the potentially deadly BRCA genetic mutation since they lost their mother to cancer

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From the Kent Cinque Port of Deal, Michael Portillo heads to Walmer Castle, home during the 1920s to Lord Beauchamp, whose openly homosexual lifestyle led to his exile from the country. And in Margate, Michael discovers the connection to TS Eliot

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Herne Bay to Leeds Castle, Kent
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the Kent seaside resort of Herne Bay, where he learns about a pioneering aviatrix who began her working life as a typist in Hull. In the seaside town of Whitstable, he tucks into its famous staple, oysters. Michael later crosses the North Downs to Lenham, and visits Leeds Castle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels in Greater London, beginning on its south-eastern fringe in the village of Chislehurst and ending up in Kennington to learn about the childhood of Charlie Chaplin

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels through the capital in the heart of Londons East End. First, Michael explores Hackney Wick, where he hears about The Daily Worker newspapers origins, before heading to Londons West End to hunt down Londons oldest surviving Indian restaurant, Veeraswamy. Here, he tries his hand at making chapatis, under the watchful eye of the restaurants master chef

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up an impressive five vehicle haul from a collector who can no longer look after his motors. Pauls out on the road collecting a rare 1972 Lancia Fulvia Berlina

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek casts his eye over a Citroen 2CV, before he is off admiring the treasure trove of more than 270 motorbikes in the same garage

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of the discovery and exploitation of the Baku Oilfields in the Russian Caucasus, which forced Stalin and Hitler to face-off in the battle of Stalingrad

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Tatton Park in Cheshire, where a member of the public delights Henry Sandon by bringing along one of the rarest known pieces of 18th-century Royal Worcester porcelain. The experts also run the rule over a surprisingly valuable box of golf balls and a collection of diamonds that is not all it appears to be

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts examine more rarities at Tatton Park in Cheshire, including a silver inkstand reputed to have been given to Admiral Nelson by his lover Lady Emma Hamilton, and an oak coffer that arrives aboard an unusual mode of transport. Plus, John Benjamin discovers a precious item lurking in a box of costume jewellery

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek waxes lyrical about a pristine Jaguar XJ8 and a Ford Model T van tests his driving skills

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts return to Hampton Court Castle in Herefordshire, where items up for valuation include a silver dish given to former prime minister Neville Chamberlain, a set of drinking urns shaped as Herefordshire bulls, and a collection of SAS medals

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries

He then cruises beneath Conisbroughs magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal

programme.desc: The comedian meets three dogs in need of companionship. First up is excitable 10-month-old mongrel Blake, who loves playing with his toys - but when Paul suspects his eyesight is not as it should be and the vets confirm his fears, the presenter is given the challenge of finding the canine a suitable friend to act as his very own guide dog. Paul also meets Jacko the Jack Russell, who has been down in the dumps ever since arriving at Battersea, and 14-week-old Saluki Forest, who is in quarantine due to a stomach bug. Paul tries to come up with a way of keeping the puppy entertained - but with no physical contact allowed, that proves easier said than done

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs

Paul also meets Yorkshire terrier Dash, whose bark has lost its bite leaving him with a very unusual, squeaky voice. programme.desc: Presenter Lucy Kennedy gets to know comedian Brendan Grace. As well as inviting her into his home, he takes her on a tour of some places that are special to him. programme.title: Autopsy USA
programme.desc: Forensic pathologists investigate the cases of celebrities who died unexpectedly. This episode focuses on actor Burt Reynolds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: When two guests arrive at Grey House and are immediately at odds, Cassie uses her magic to ensure that until the two guests realise they belong together, every day in Middleton will be just like to one before it. Sam tries to plan the perfect date for Cassie, but various nuisances keep getting in the way. Abigail continues getting the same delivery over and over, until she recognizes the value she provides the community

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King visit the Stackpole Inn in Pembrokeshire, a multi award-winning gastro pub. Owners Gary and Becky first took it on 15 years ago, and were joined in 2019 by head chef Matt Waldron. Its the Bikers mission to introduce Matt and team Stackpole to the fantastic local food producers that arent yet on their radar

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi sets out to improve the fortunes of the Glangrwyney Court guest house in the Black Mountains, Powys. Despite its five-star rating and reasonable occupancy rate, owners Christina and Warrick Jackson reveal they are rapidly losing money. Alex is taken aback by the amount of clutter in the rooms and the low prices being charged, and informs the couple that if they make changes, their salvation could lie in targeting the lucrative corporate market

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Gillian McKeith hosts a dinner party for four guests, who will win a cash prize if they can guess her identity from cryptic culinary clues. Raw lasagne is among the healthy options the nutritionist is planning to serve and whoever loses the challenge will have to do the washing-up. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Police mount a special operation across the airport, and passenger experience manager Taz rushes to the aid of a passenger on her way to Warsaw who takes a tumble on an escalator. Elsewhere, a five-star airline tries to make a comeback with its business class

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Peggy begins a frantic search for Davids dog Deefer after a pair of youths steal her car from outside the Aidensfield Arms with the hound in the boot. Carol and Rob have cause for concern as Rosie is troubled by the attentions of an admirer who simply will not take no for an answer - and also has a history of violence against a former girlfriend. Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and Vanessa Hehir star

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Oh! To Be in England - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pop busies himself organising a christening while awaiting the birth of his first grandchild - and still finds time to cast a beady eye over the contents of an elderly widows home. Whimsical rural drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bear is distraught, while Robert is shaken and Nicola warns Kev off

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Becky fights back when she finds herself targeted, Carl implicates Debbie in a financial oversight, and Cassie takes Tyrone to his physio appointment when Fiz is called away

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Becky fights back when she finds herself targeted, Carl implicates Debbie in a financial oversight, and Cassie takes Tyrone to his physio appointment when Fiz is called away

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Rose and Dr Ormerod attempt to rescue a drowning boy during a trip to a hippie commune. Catherine is asked on a date by a local fisherman, while Dr Goodwin discovers the parents of a sick baby are not all they seem after he diagnoses the infants illness. Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Millionaires wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the womans husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearings outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker and Miller struggle to decide whether an ex-Army major is guilty of murder after shooting a youth who broke into his home, while Carol tries to get through to a pregnant teenager. Rosie learns the garage is in financial trouble - unaware Peggy and a salesman with big ideas (impressionist Jon Culshaw) have already dreamed up a plan that could save it. Jonathan Kerrigan and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but delving into the victims story, Vera unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron finds what he is looking for, while Belle formulates a new plan and Bear is torn

programme.title: Rig 45
programme.desc: The remaining crew is split into two groups as everyone suspects each other of being the murderer. Tensions rise and as the crew buckles down, waiting for help to arrive, they realise they must start talking in order to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Catherine Walker

programme.title: Trigger Point
programme.desc: The terror campaign continues when a journalist is sent a suspicious package, suggesting a new bomb set to explode that evening. The gang appears to be taunting the authorities, but a source then emerges from the shadows with what appears to be solid intelligence on the terror cell. With little else to go on, can mysterious informant Alex really be trusted?

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy and her family arrive in the countryside to celebrate Dereks birthday. Michael is there too, which Jason finds troubling. Family comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan, Sam Swainsbury and Ross Boatman

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.sub-title: How to Say I Love You!
programme.desc: The whole town is caught up in romance when Cassie helps Ben find an old film for him to show on opening night of the refurbished Middleton Theater - a classic love movie from the 1930s How to Say, I Love You! - which proves to be a very meaningful title. Meanwhile, Martha has overextended herself with the Middleton budget, and there is no money left in the extra expenditure account

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, whos front of house. Its the Bikers job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: British couple Liz and Michael Callis emigrated from Britain and bought a 14-bedroom guest house in the Swiss Alps, but their hopes of a stress-free retirement have been ruined by a heavy workload. Alex Polizzi outlines her vision for the future of the hotel, including smart uniforms for the staff, a drop in food prices and a transformation for an unused formal dining room - but is unimpressed with the results when she returns a month later

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Singer Joe McElderry hosts a dinner party for four strangers, who try to guess their mystery hosts identity, with the aim of winning a cash prize, while the famous faces try to avoid having to wash up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Police detain a passenger whose bag is suspected to contain three firearms, Virgin has a launch party for their new route to the live music capital of the world - Austin, Texas, and passenger experience manager Hannah rushes to the aid of a seasoned traveller who takes a funny turn

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker and Miller struggle to decide whether an ex-Army major is guilty of murder after shooting a youth who broke into his home, while Carol tries to get through to a pregnant teenager. Jonathan Kerrigan and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Oh! To Be in England - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Preparations get under way for the christening, while Primrose loses her heart to a very confused vicar. Pop gets a black eye, Edith Pilchester tackles a gang of roving Teddy boys and Mademoiselle Dupont begins to feel ill. Drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Documentary following a major construction project at Claridges, revealing the engineering challenges involved in digging out a five-storey basement, adding four new floors to the top of the hotel and creating Londons most expensive penthouse. In the first edition, Donegal miners work 24 hours a day to tunnel under the hotel by hand, while hotel manager Eugene tries hard to ensure loyal guests like David Walliams, Christian Louboutin and Damien Hirst remain undisturbed by the work going on above and below them

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron finds what he is looking for, while Belle formulates a new plan and Bear is torn

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours, including the halls previous owner Dolly Bantry. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the stars unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A beauty queen is targeted by mysterious attackers ahead of the Miss Yorkshire contest, which attracts more than the usual share of attention when busloads of female protesters turn up to picket the event. Ordered to boost his arrest record, Younger finds a novel way of raising the villages crime rate, while Phil spies an opportunity to get closer to Gina. Steven Blakeley and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: The Night Caller
programme.desc: A vengeful Tony creeps into Lawrences house to face him. Lawrence thinks hes being burgled, until he recognises the intruder as the cabbie who picked him up earlier that night. Subtle comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.sub-title: From the Coffee to the Korean K-Pop Diet
programme.desc: Part two of two. programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the final of the celebrity cookery series, as the three remaining stars face their toughest challenge yet in a bid to walk off with the title. The stakes are high, and only one will be crowned this years winner

programme.title: Million Pound Pawn
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawn kingpin Dan Hatfield meets former care home worker Catherine who, after a recent bereavement, is hoping a Rolex watch can change her fortunes. Kathy Lyons first client in affluent Cheshire is divorced businesswoman Namita, who is hoping to sell her gold wedding jewellery, while in the well-heeled borough of Kensington, luxury goods dealers Adam and Emily Abraham welcome back regular client Danica, who wants to trade her Chanel handbag collection for one of the most exclusive bags in the world

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen return with the celebrity cooking contest in which famous faces are mentored by world-class chefs as they compete in culinary cooking battles. in the opening edition, Carol Vorderman, Abbey Clancy, Pasha Kovalev and Harry Pinero compete to deliver stand-out dinner party dishes and progress to the next round

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Ishan from Macclesfield, Marie from Essex, Taylor originally from Iowa, and Fiona from Gloucestershire and that cash prize is the small matter of one of the countrys finest quizzers. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers Preview
programme.desc: A look ahead to Marchs FIFA World Cup play-offs and a round-up of the qualifying action from the group stage

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Pafos v Monaco (Kick-off 5.45pm). Coverage of the league phase match from Stelios Kyriakides Stadium

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Arsenal v Bayern Munich (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the matchday five league phase fixture at Etihad Stadium. These are the only two teams with 100 per cent records in this seasons competition, and they will each be looking to make a statement this evening. The sides last met in the quarter-finals of the 2023/24 tournament, when Munich prevailed 3-2 on aggregate

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Dubai
programme.desc: Caroline Stanbury and Lesa dig their heels in as they hash out their issues, and the ladies exchange gifts to show what they think of one another

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Fifty Shades star Dakota Johnson, who is joining the Spider-Man universe as clairvoyant telepath Madame Web. He also catches up with Sterling K Brown - Randall from This Is Us - who is starring in the critically acclaimed satire American Fiction. His other guests are Oscar-nominated Colman Domingo, who is playing the civil rights activist Bayard Rustin in the biographical drama Rustin, and Harry Potter and Star Wars actor Domhnall Gleeson, who is appearing in Channel 4s romantic drama Alice and Jack. Plus, Paul Russell performs his current single and viral hit, Lil Boo Thang

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny and Moira meet with a key demographic, Alexis struggles with her new job and David offers emotional support to his bosss daughter

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny and Moira contend with a surprise guest, while Alexis and David look for an apartment
